Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in determining the marriage was not genuine under amended regulations
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's wife used an English-only profile, limited communication, rapid pursuit of relationship
Evidence_Type: Communication patterns, online profile usage, timeline of relationship development
Legal_Provision: Amended section 4(1) of Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine or entered into for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of genuine marital relationship indicators
Proceeding_Type: Appeal before Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: Amended section 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Legal_Standard: Bad faith under amended s. 4(1) if marriage not genuine or for immigration purposes
Application_Factor: Speed of relationship development, language use, communication frequency
Decision_Outcome: Marriage found not genuine; visa refusal upheld
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the IAD err in its application of the law or factual findings?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Amended section 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage not genuine and potentially entered for immigration purposes
Legal_Provision_Cited: Amended section 4(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Limited communication evidence, use of single-language profile
Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on authenticity of marital relationship
